results.title: The Birchip Cropping Group
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: A background history of the Birchip Cropping Group, an agricultural research and extension organisation covering the Wimmera Mallee region set up to assist farmers in crop production. Its philosophy is to produce food that is clean, safe and green. Presented by Alexandra, Fiona, James, Simon and the BCG.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development

results.title: The Mallee tree
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: With its roots deeply set in the earth the humble Mallee finds its strength to face the uncertain challenges of nature. Its tenacity to survive and live on through long droughts and harsh weather conditions is symbolic of the Birchip community who also face similar challenges in their own lives. Written and performed by Glenys Rickard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development

results.title: The Black pages
results.brief_description: Stunning yet restrained cinematography is a feature of this beautifully lit work which demonstrates controlled use of colour in a piece employing controlled kinetic movement within the frame. Considered visual composition and a strong soundtrack support an intriguing storyline.
results.description: Stunning yet restrained cinematography is a feature of this beautifully lit work which demonstrates controlled use of colour in a piece employing controlled kinetic movement within the frame. Considered visual composition and a strong soundtrack support an intriguing storyline.

results.title: Amour de la toilette
results.brief_description:
Subtlety is the key to this brilliantly conceived hand drawn animation that employs the simple technology of a whiteboard and markers to create an engaging evocation of Paris. The use of minimalist materials is supported by thorough planning skills, the controlled use of camera and a storyline that is achievable within the limitations of the medium.
Music by The Cafe Accordian Orchestra.
